8sbDzBPke_f1SoI_cQD3dw.text: I've passed by this building a lot and didn't even know what it really was until a buddy of mine suggested to have dinner here one night. (I didn't even know how to say the restaurant name lol)   I walked in (make sure you make a rsvp because it can get busy) and while I was waiting for my friends to show up I noticed a gift shop (right side) before you enter the restaurant itself. The gift shop gave me a great idea of what I was getting myself into for dinner. I noticed all these beer mugs and realized it was going to be an Oktoberfest environment.    The host walked us to our table and I was in all ahhh in everything in here. I felt like I was really in Germany. The LIVE music, the uniforms, the tables, the food and the whole building itself. When it was time to order our dinner our server Olga was amazing. Very friendly and helpful in helping us with what to order. She recommended the Pretzel for an appetizer, Grillhendl for dinner and Kasekuchen for desert.   Pretzel - It came out quick and it was delicious. Warm and fresh. The 3 different dipping sauces were all yummy.   Grillhendl - The chicken was so moist and the potato salad that it came with it was very tasty.   Kasekuchen - This was a Bavarian cheesecake with raspberry sauce.  OMG this was so freaking good. The cheesecake was very fluffy and it had enough raspberry sauce for every bit.   At 7:30pm the LIVE SINGER told every to stand up on our benches. Yes!!!! We really stood up on our benches and started doing the............ "CHICKEN DANCE" it was so much fun. I don't drink but everyone that did had their beer mugs in the air and everyone had a great time!   My friends I was with had their German sausages and said they were good. TIP!!!! Make sure you check inn on yelp and get yourself a FREE beer. I recommend this place! I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So yummy! 12/13/2018
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I totally recommend! 12/13/2018

oD_WyRpJ0e4fqsnSaf2tFg.text: Overpriced for average/below average German food with mediocre service. Seems ok to grab a beer and listen to some Bavarian music....

dvH8kghBCwoV_rHh3ri6RA.text: We had the best time here. Got a free beer by using yelp to check in. Lots of good food. Waitress was so friendly and helpful. You have to get the apple strudel is a must

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple strudel is a must
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer beer small one was the free one

t7Q3Fd_I5juM6vE_IvzAsA.text: Hard to find good German food, so when we saw this place nearby the hotel we were staying at we decided to check it out. Friendly staff, lots of open family style seating like a German beer garden. Fun ambiance. Everyone was very attentive. We decided to order the pretzel combo for our appetizer. Came with two types of mustard and cheese. It was good, but we've had better. For the entrees, I got the Bayerische spezialitaten plate which came with pork roast, a pork chop and a sausage. The roast pork and sausage was very good, but the pork chop was dry and didn't have much flavor. My wife ordered the Oktoberfest bratenteller which was barvarian pork and beef in hunter sauce. She liked it, but the sauce was a bit on the sweet side. Portions for both dishes were fairly large. Overall, not too bad, but we've had better German food

Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large dining area, family style
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oktoberfest Bratenteller

iJMvB9bbLIx1mQJ4HIqs0Q.text: Five stars every time I come here. This is DHs and my first stop when we fly into Vegas and our last stop before we leave for the airport. (As a result we always have suitcases in tow). No worries, there is plenty of room for luggage here in the festhaus. We love it when the live music is going as well, so festive and reminiscent of our time in Munich for Oktoberfest years ago.   For the vegans- you are in luck. This is the only place in the US so far that I have found vegan schnitzel. And it is delicious! They include cranberry sauce and delish potato salad (sounds underwhelming? well don't you worry, it doesn't disappoint!)   It is always so hard to decide between the vegan schnitzel and the vegan curry frankfurters. So, we have to come here at least twice during our stay in Vegas, that way I can have both. (And sometime 3 times...) Oh and beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian schnitzel
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jaegerschnitzel

kq-eIPll1b2pTxp3HyCy_A.text: Gemutlichwhat?  Something was missing. Sure, there were liters of Hofbrau, meters of sausage, and servers pouring out of their dirndls. I'm a big fan of those things. There was live music, big bench style tables, and a beerhall large enough to host any Oktoberfest that the Vegas crowd could throw at it, but yet, there was something very important that was missing. It started when I walked in, alone. I was asked if I wanted to sit at the bar. Well, the bar is the least German place I have ever seen. About 12 seats long, there were three different sports balls games going at one time, and it had all of the warmth and coziness as a Walmart entryway. Why would I come to a German Beerhall to sit at a TGI McFunster-style bar to eat my wurstteller? Once I convinced the three-hostesses to let me sit in the beerhall, I was asked for my email, phone #, first born, etc... Not cool bro. Then the real fun began. First, let me say that the beerhall is awesome. It's huge, and really reminds me of the main hall at the Hofbrauhaus in Munich, except that this one was EMPTY. Sure, it was early-ish on a Weds evening (about 6:00ish), but probably 80% of the tables were completely empty. So, why then was I sat at the farthest away from the stage table when I said I wanted to be close to the band? Worst of all, I was seated facing the wall, so my view was literally, nothing! To boot, there were four other people at the table who were totally offended that I was sat with them. Folks, if you have ever been in a real beerhall, you would know that this is the best way to meet people. Assuming that everyone here are tourist, it should have been a great place to strike up a conversation with the people to your right or left, but these folks just didn't get it. Of the four of them, only two were drinking beer, and only one of those were drinking German beer. They shared a single small pretzel. Why in God's name were they here, and why I was sat next to these people. Enough of the bad.... I was very happy that the food was exactly as I hoped it would be. I ordered the sausage platter (wurst teller) and it was great! Two frankfurters and two Nurnberger bratwurst served with a side of kraut and proper mustard. And of course there was the beer. I assume that the HB beer served here is imported from Munich. It was proper. Also, my waitress was very attentive and my food came out quickly.  Will I be back? Yes, but not by myself. There were videos being run on a loop showing crowds of people having a great time, so clearly I was here on a slow day. I really feel if the hostess had been more considerate with where I was sat, I would have had a better time. Lesson learned. Next time I will bring the party with me!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Würstplatte!!!

4GeJF7M5357gJ3QhR4e3oA.text: Omg. I have never had so much fun eating lunch anywhere else! This is a party in a bottle with the best authentic German food.   Walking in you have a huge high convex ceiling with beautiful decor and live music that vibrates the building.   My husband and I came for lunch and sat at a table with a couple who it was their first time too.  We all had fun listening to the live music and watching people get spanked with their shots for their birthdays.   The best part of the whole amazing experience was the food. I had the fried fish with housemade potato salad 10/10 absolutely perfect. My husband had sausage, which was devine. And then we took a slice of German chocolate cake home for desert. 10/10 savoring flavor and quality ingredients.   I cant wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10/10 amazing!!
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and potato salad
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bavarian Pretzel 10/10 amazing

g0dGOeWqGLMmzxoqV5LLtQ.text: What a fun experience! My mom and I went to Oktoberfest in Munich a few years ago and we always look back so fondly on the memories (some of which might be fuzzy due to beer) we made there. Coming to Hofbrauhaus was such a treat and so reminiscent of our time at Oktoberfest! We came with my dad and my sister - my dad and I are vegetarian so we were so happy to see the vegan options. They were delicious! The pretzel was also amazing - they say they are imported from Germany and whether or not that is True, I absolutely love that they were huge and served with delicious dips.   Now, let's get to the entertainment. We came on a Sunday afternoon so I fully expected it to be a quiet meal. When we got there, we only saw about 5 or so tables full but, no matter, the entertainer still went on! He was wearing traditional lederhosen, was singing traditional German drinking songs (e.g. ein prosit), and even had a Swedish horn! He also had us play drinking games, which were so fun. My mom and I won a free beer!   Last thing - I would not recommend the dessert here. They were not bad, just nothing too special. Not worth taking a star off, but worth mentioning because it's a good idea to get a sweet bit elsewhere if you're really into finishing your meals with something sugary.

aGrdDZEyBfHhvL48ASvZ-g.text: My husband lived in Germany for 12 years and wanted to eat here. We came on a Monday night, we sat with a couple who were dining here for their first time as well. All their beer is imported from Germany. We each got a mug of beer, hubby got the Original Beer and I got the Seasonal Oktoberfestier Beer which they only have during Octoberfest. The beer was very good and strong. For our meals I ordered the Riesenbratwurst and hubby ordered the Oktoberfest Bratenteller. All the food was delicious and filling.  Our server was Coco, he was super cool and always kept our drinks full.  They had musicians performing, they would shout out something and the crowd would say "Ho", lift their glass then drink beer. A lady was spanking people at a table and very hard, you could see their ass wobble, it was hilarious. This was the most fun I've ever had at a restaurant.   Everything about this place was wonderful from the food, the service, the entertainment, Coco. Everything was great, now I wanna be plan a vacation to Germany.

Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pemk_vKgpzAo_Q2W41EhFQ.text: Came here after work with some of the Trybe... I hear this place looks just like Germany? Never been but after going here I definitely want to travel there :).  I was angry a bit faded when we got there but the environment was fun and the food was great. Got spanked and OMG it hurt haha   Great for bday parties or with friends...ill have to go again

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I hear this is just like germany

VM2lFZxH-yx4caWlGMrIcg.text: Wow, what a place! I had dinner plans with some of my colleagues, and one of them is a Vegas regular. He confidently suggested Hofbrauhaus. What better way to turn up a Friday night?  They should have checked in at the host stand while waiting for me, since the wait must have been at least 45 minutes. Instead we enjoyed a beer by the front bar and talked.   Finding our seats was a maze. So much going on here! Music, theatrics, spanking... Apparently Hofbrauhaus is popular for bachelor parties. Rolling my eyes out of my head.  We sat at our little table in the back patio, aka the fake outdoors. These types of rooms in Vegas always get me. Way to set the ambiance. For dinner, one colleague and I shared the white sausage plate with a few sides.  The food was not bad. Then again, I don't have much of a standard for German food. Our waitress seemed impatient with us, but maybe it'd been a long day for her.  We ended our meal with apple strudel because it came with ice cream. It wasn't quite what I expected, but it was a sweet way to end our meal. While I'd definitely come back for the beer, I wasn't too hot about the food. It's an experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple Strudel
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Sausage Plate

7gkQ1raK2oC7vCE_DmyBWQ.text: Came here for a group event which included having us sit in the back garden area, which was away from the loud and fun in the front.  We were treated to a platter of lunch like meats and large pretzels with dipping choices. Nothing exciting about either of these besides the size of the pretzels. Enjoyed some beer, both the 0.5L and full liter, which were fun to hold! It should be noted that they are heavy, so it's super impressive to watch the waitresses carry them all. While it may not be my choice of places to hangout when you are surrounded by the life of Vegas, it was perfect for our group event.

mH5pp5DlbLcEC5h4sKN5Ew.text: You have got to check this place out......4-realz. With its authenticity for the German culture, this is the go to spot. From decor to music to food, I loved it all. The beer was awesome. The pretzel, sausages, and sour kraut were really good. If I weren't already full from our day, I'd devour the whole entire tray of food. The potato cake was delish as well. Tables were long and good for 1 big family or 2-3 families. It was a great way for family style dining or meeting new friends. I am part German who has never been to Germany or anywhere in Europe, as a matter of fact, but it's just what I would've imagined it be like when I go........24/7 Oktoberfest. They had shots too, if you didn't finish the shot, a spanking with a paddle would soon ensued. Wow. I usually love a good spanking by my husband in private but I was really scared that if I asked for a shot, I would be publicly called out. They do have a bar towards the back so if you wanna shot but not into spanks then just slip out to grab yourself an old fashioned shot of Jagermeister, which to me is surprisingly good.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aucCXhmwlvY8sF-zJmLrlQ.text: Hofbrauhaus was recommended to us so we came here for our first night in Vegas with the kids.  The restaurant layout was pretty cool...long wooden booths laid out across the dining room where I imagine you share tables with others when busy.  They had live music going and waitresses "spanking" guys with wooden paddles. (My husband didn't do it, booooo).  Food was really good.  Lots of pork, potatoes, and gravy options.  I haven't  really had German food, but thought this place was good.  We ordered the sausage platter and there was one sausage on there that basically looked like a hotdog, but all the rest we enjoyed!

iWmFEj8zSFJULu8veNYCzw.text: LOVE this place!! So glad we got there on this 2nd trip to LV! It is off the strip, but EASY to get to. All you do, is get to the HARD ROCK CAFE shuttle from the main strip on Las Vegas Blvd South, and walk across the street to Hofbrahaus. Then you're there! We were instantly transported into Germany! The waitstaff all had on authentic German/Bavarian garb and they couldn't be nicer. (all except 1 waiter. He was a total bitchy queen, but once I requested a new waiter, all was well. The place was SO fun, I couldn't have anyone ruin it!) The place is loud and raucous, and FUN! There is a band who plays German music, a jagermeister girl who spanks your behind pretty hard after you take a shot, and great food and beer. I had a smoked pork platter with AMAZING German potato salad, sauerkraut and red cabbage. The place was great and we didn't want to leave. They also had delicious looking desserts that we had no room to sample. We were SO FULL. Everything was reasonably priced, and the environment was awesome. I would def make a point to return whenever I am in Vegas.

2vrgZMzoXJ-797l7Rxi8Uw.text: I had so much fun here when I visited with two friends.  We started with 40oz steins of beer and settled in for what was supposed to be an hour wait  (be smart, make a reservation).  Instead, after about 20 minutes we were whisked in to be seated at the German beer hall style bench seating.  The oompa band was playing and immediately we were involved in the action.  "Stand on the bench" the singer kept yelling.  "Raise your steins!" he continued.  Where else do you get to stand on the table, sing, chug beers and not get tossed out?  Our fellow diners were sauced and having a great time, but never rowdy or unfriendly.  We got a plate of sausage and some incredible pretzels.  The waitresses were awesome and very sexily dressed in classic tavern maid garb.  The action continued with drinking contests, the playing of the horns, and stein holding contests.  Get there early because the place shuts down by midnight.

XWF2DiRN85Sl_EzSvCAsjQ.text: great place had lots of fun there.really good beer knid of pricy

6vnuFZbdoIuNfwIgAA_Uzg.text: I would not recommend this place to any of friends or family. The food at best is average but you are paying extra because you are near the strip. You can catch a little dirt and grime here and there. Maybe after all those drunk weekends. But if like hot sausages in your mouth then this place is for you. Don't swallow.

MKlzA_mVqPhaINFNI8ycPg.text: My husband and I went here for our anniversary for the first time.  The Mnchner Weisswrste was fabulous!  The Grillhendl which is Half Roasted Chicken, not as good as I thought it would be.  The place was alive with live music, some fun dancing and tables are laid out like picnic tables you see in Rest Areas.  If you make a reservation, you will be seated with other people but you can request to move to another table that is not occupied.   The Pretzels for appetizers are much softer which we liked than the ones included in the meal of choice.  The Potato Soup was good. If you like beer, this is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oIXcuRjP3BuzuXSvg3Tvew.text: First time visit to this establishment after hearing a ton of "good things" from co-workers.  Was in town for a trade show and the first place we visited for dinner and drinks was this spot.  When I walked in, I thought I walked through a time machine and went back a few decades to a restaurant in Germany.  Once inside, you forget that you are even in Las Vegas.  For some, that might be good and for others, a deal breaker.  It was loud.  There was a band playing what sounded like German folk songs.  Oh wells, "when in Rome" they say...  Service was good.  It was friendly.  It was fast.  Beer and sausages.  What else would you want?  We had some plates of pretzels and this deep fried item that remind me of tonkatsu.  The gal walking around with the paddle and shot glasses was cool.  We had a few in our group that went for the paddling, which I suppose is popular within this establishment.  I say, "to each their own."  I would come back but with a beer loving crowd.  If you need a quieter place to eat and drink, look elsewhere.  As they say in Germany, gut essen !!  Enjoy!

dODvTARmM34rwDo5l9bPOQ.text: Horrible. Just left. Service was bad bad bad. Wait staff was huddled in the back laughing and not dong anything to wait on us. Twice I asked someone else to find my waitress. Once just to be able to order after sitting in a near empty restaurant for five minutes.   I'm seriously allergic to beef. Asked if the bean soup has dairy or beef in it. After I ate almost half the bowl, and confirmed with two people no beef, the waitress rushed over and said it's made w beef broth. We got our sausage and pork with a brown sauce. I asked... beef? Got a HUGE eye roll.   Food. Mediocre at best. Seriously mean that. If you like German food. Go somewhere else. If you don't care that much and want beer in a big glass, tourist thing and a live band at night - and pay out your ass for mediocre food. It's great.

aVS1yIAerG-3HukJcCA-wA.text: Awesome german food great environment fun place lots of TVs to watch Soccer amazing architecture huge portions - get one for two people unless you want to maintain your obesity  you can also play a famous german game of beer + ass slapping

dVjmmU2AIeBE0PtixwlgVQ.text: We were rudely treated by the hostesses and one waitress here. My goodness- we did not understand that we needed to wait to be seated since the hostesses were just standing there talking so we walked passed them and sat down to listen to the music. The first approach by a waitress was that we couldn't seat ourselves... you know, it was our mistake and misunderstanding however- it was HOW we were approached. Then the hostess reprimanded us when we came out to be seated. She was unfriendly all the way to the seating. The ambiance was fun, music entertaining- our waitress was a dear. The only positive experience. Most of the staff was miserable and unwelcoming .

q-aprvpDb8c7IrDExJSfOg.text: The atmosphere was on point. They had alive music and the guy was amazing. He could play any instrument there. Food was great and it tasted just like in Germany. Whatever they did it was on point. The pretzel was really really soft. Great spot for authentic German food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best pretzel I&#39;ve ever had

LNwN2C1phy7gyG90i_WoDA.text: Oktoberfest arrives each year, Hofbrauhaus is the only place people want to go. Live music, traditional costumes, excellent customer service arrives with the best Bavarian traditional taste. From the Mayor to the city's best magicians, the best place to party is this Bavarian restaurant. Paradise and Harmon, right across the street from the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, and a short walk from our house, a great place to meet celebrities visiting the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino.

tKYgh0dkMFJcTk-vpho2ng.text: Food was absolutely delicious, I decided to try something totally out of my comfort zone and was completely glad that I did because everything on my plate was delicious, I wish I could remember the name of what I ordered but it was 3 types of pork, sausage/pork roast and something else with fluffy yummy mashed potatoes and sour kraut. Hubby ordered the schnitzel of course and I wish I would've ordered that instead of my plate, which is saying something because my dinner was to die for. We're local and came to celebrate my hubby's birthday, he was so excited! We went on a night where they were doing a tapping on a new beer and were having a big party so everyone in the restaurant got a free beer. Everything was so fun until a big party came in and our waitress completely ignored us. After an hour and a half since we had gotten our food and were ready to leave we couldn't even wave her down. We asked someone to grab her for us and her response was "I don't know who your waiter is" and walked away from us. We ended up spending a whole extra hour and a half here frustrated because we couldn't get our check and then had to wait for her to come back to pay. We'll be back next year for hubby's birthday because he was in love with the food, but for almost $100 for the two of us to eat and have such a horrible experience I'm very disappointed.

D0gg3F0qlf-OsSJC2hj9sg.text: My best friend is German and she happened to be craving German food one night and asked if we could please, please go to the Hofbrauhaus.  I had never experienced it, so I decided to give it a whirl.  We showed up and all the servers are in costume.  I love that!  Some people might think it's lame, but I personally think it adds to the experience!    Huge beers? Yupp, my version heaven!  The beers were good, big, and flowing all night!  We spent quite a long time drinking and snacking the night away!  Their food?  Just as good as the beer!! Since my bestie and I are both equally indecisive, we decided to split two of their main dishes.  We got the burger and the chicken sandwich.  Both were AMAZING!  The meat combination in the burger had the perfect flavor and made it stand out compared to other burgers I've had in this city.  The chicken sandwich was perfectly crispy and I enjoyed every second of it.    It wouldn't be a complete German experience without getting a pretzel!  Just as enjoyable as our main dishes.    Having the german music in the background, great food, and good service... this place earns its 4 stars.  It's a bit pricey, which makes me upset because I can't afford to go there more often.  But, I will definitely be back as a local when I'm feeling the German itch!

SQktB97UCkaazBAOt0GIpw.text: First time here.  It was a great experience.  It's on the list side,  so if that's not your thing try the beer garden in the back.  The band was great.  Order the shots samples and you get a paddle across the butt, very entertaining for the observers.   The food is good.  I split the 365 with my mom and it was enough.  For me the process are somewhat high averaging are $20 a plate. But if you can split it with someone do so.    The giant beers are fun. 34 oz. Not a large selection though.   Overall it was a good time.

P1hIuLK9p4D09JuhS2qqWA.text: Hadn't been here for a few years and stopped in last night with a few friends. Beers are way too frickin' expensive at $9 for a pint. The bratwurst deal my buddy bought had the skinniest sausage on the planet and way too much bread, see picture.  Really dead with hardly anyone there and the hostess lied on the phone saying Monday was a great night with a good crowd. Our waitress was mediocre and the band was pretty boring to be honest.  We won't be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A lot of bread and a skinny brat :(

YF9qDcWHOvT0pG2U7QD-EQ.text: Loved going here on my first date, valet was easy through the hotel next door, the servers were really really friendly, they spank you when you take shots (so funny) and the food was amazing. I had the veal sausage and the Oktoberfest bier .. yum! I'd take my family back here anytime. I wish it wasn't so loud here but that's par for the course at a place with drinking. Entertainment was wonderful and the building is beautiful. Everything is clean and nice.

LCna3bmbG1JOF-1x0GrtQA.text: My review is a little biased because I love German food and the Hofbrauhaus. I've been to the one in Munich and one of the franchise locations in northern Kentucky as well.   Loved the food, and most importantly the beer. We had a great server that made everything that much more fun.  Public style seating gets you meeting new people too.   If you're in Vegas and never been to a German beer garden before, I recommend going here, even if just for a pretzel and a 1 litre beer.

Z9Zn9m9DiNYfQiGv0sbFqg.text: Buddy and I had a great time here.   Food is authentic and beer is solid.   Prost!

6hnczJo1MYl9bwdaMCvetw.text: Outstanding authentic German cuisine, atmosphere amazing beer, music, great experience!

1UfIJFjbcgMQV3DYMWuOCQ.text: Went there a couple months ago and omg it was amazing. Our server Nic was the fucking best!!! He gave us a history lesson as he waited on the table. He literally knows everything about hofbrau. He made the experience!!! Not only is he cute af, but he is also a great spanker!!!! My ass never hurt so good.  Definitely going back and requesting him.

G0Y5WMgktQLcEaOfMPdKKg.text: Summary:  - Beer as good as Hofbrauhaus in Munchen - Food was disappointing - Location feels touristy and takes away from authenticity  I have been to the Hofbrauhaus in Munchen, Pittsburgh, Newport and now Las Vegas. I would have to say I love me some Hofbrauhaus! The beer is without a doubt the most crisp and clean beer that is the epitome of German beers brewed under the German beer purity laws (say that ten times fast).  As for this place it in ever sense of the word the most water down version of the original Hofbrauhaus in Munchen. The location doesn't give this church of beer justice, it adds the Vegas grime and it ends up feeling like it is robbed of its authenticity. The pretzel was great! but the lack of mustards was disappointing, usually there is regional addition that can be added to your pretzel (ex/ awesome beer cheese in Pittsburgh), in Vegas you get some cold cheese spread... WTH!

d774Z5IAy7Lq0mtNOKuRtA.text: The food was amazing and only surpassed by the service! Our waitress Juliane was the best! Def the strongest arm in the place-and a cracked paddle to prove it!!

WPk5oXR-G1F-W8Og9ycJ7g.text: Love this place!  Veteran of the Munich October fest.  Went to school in Wisconsin (German settled if you don't know). This isn't close, but brings back great memories...  stopped in to check it out.  Ended up staying for just a couple of beers (liter each!)  Had a great time.  The sausage tower was great!  Loved the beer. pretzel, mustard and atmosphere!  Munich In Vegas.  Great fun!  Not high btow, just enjoy the beer, get a shot of schnapps that will kick your ass!  Fun and I'll  come back for sure!

L3BhlMxJEAyS8QXXaebeMA.text: I am so unhappy with my experience here at Hofbrauhas that I am sitting here posting my review in the restaurant as we speak.    They get one star for the building and atmosphere.    Our waitress was nice enough to start.  We ordered sodas with no ice and a couple minutes later she brings us out soda glasses that are half full.  No exaggeration at all.  We look at her and ask what's up and she explains that their system only pours so much soda per drink and with no ice it leaves the glass half full.  She then explains that you get two refills and we can use one of our refills to fill the glass.  What the hell?  Are you serious?  I have NEVER been to a restaurant with that policy.  This is a pretty pricy place so the fact they are cheap on soda is doubly strange.  And I wanted to substitute fries for the potato salad in my 18 dollar meal and she said no substitutions.  Also my dad asked the waitress what kind of German beverages that were available that were non alcoholic and the waitress got an attitude and laughed at him.    I don't care if the food is good or not.  I don't care if the girls are dressed up like they are working Fantasyland at Disneyland.  For the price you pay for dinner here their policy on food and drinks suck here.    I will not return.  :0)

WsQ6403lTTWm8QVE9_4yAA.text: Hofbrauhaus! What an event!  Big plates of German food, big steins of German beer from Munich, and spanking spanking spanking!   Since we had 2 big tables of us, of course the MC pulled all of us up to do the chicken dance in front of the whole restaurant, plus almost all of the guys got spanked by the wenches (is that what they're called?)   People were just getting smacked all over the place! Those ladies do not mess around and really give it to all these guys butts. It's definitely a sight to see! The food is good and big. The beers are good and I love that the Oktoberfest ones are actually from Germany. Hofbrauhaus is definitely an Oktoberfest experience! We actually met a bunch of guys from Germany here too! Apparently we met lots of Germans all weekend.  Get ready to drink, yell, sing, stand on your chairs, dance, and just have a good time.

Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L2Uw1FZroEYHYDB_sbTuiA.text: Absolutely fantastic experience!  If you enjoy the German culture and their sense of humor, this is the perfect place.  The food was a very similar to what I got in Bavaria and the atmosphere was spot on!

5mU0IZifVxYXXemIO65BTw.text: We wanted a fun casual restaurant with good beer and great pretzels...and this place delivers.  In addition, there was a live band playing German polka songs for the most part; a beautiful lady who will deliver spankings for a price; and a person who will also photograph your group (again for a price).  Food was good.....and service was friendly.  Large restaurant with 2 rooms - one where you sit at tables with other people closer to the band; and one in the garden area where you can sit just with people you want to sit with..  We opted for the garden area, but either would make for a fun evening.....  Prices are moderate.....we had a coupon for a free 10 ounce glass of beer and they were happy to honor it.

Z6ZrghQ5s2Aqs6_OU4mvsA.text: I went to the original Hofbrauhaus in Europe and thought it was a giant tourist trap...well it's even more of a tourist trap here!   Let's play the adjective game: oom-pah filled kitschy super-loud brown creamy sauce-y (Have to make it an adjective) WTF...what's going on with those spankings? (not an adjective)  Ok, so I'm experiencing a classic Vegas moment of cognitive dissonance...something I know (and don't quite love) from Europe has been transported via the Starship Enterprise to be adjacent to my hotel in Vegas.  I can see how this place could be fun, but really?  Is there where you come in Vegas?    The Food: Food is standard German fare, and it was acceptable but nothing special.  Sausages, spaetlzle, sauerkraut, big cuts of meat in brown creamy sauce.  It's served promptly and without any circumstance.  The Beer: Well, they have the basic Hofbrauhaus beers: light, dark, a few seasonals.  Prices top actual Oktoberfest prices by quite a bit...they even make Canada and NYC seem cheap.  The Germans are not imaginative with their beer styles, but what they do, they do well.  The Atmosphere: Loud!  It's this strange super-new looking version of what is a very old establishment in Germany.  They have an oom-pah band going which they seem to have imported, however, they're quite hard to make out because the sound system is poor.  The crowd is a little bit rowdy.  You even see some real Germans there, well, because they like to eat German food when they travel.  The Weird: Whack! Is that middle-aged, fat business man being spanked by the waitress?  WTF?  They have this uber-strange practice here, in which a busty  "shot girl" comes over, sells you a shot, and gives you a very loud whack with a wooden paddle.  This is apparently their Las Vegas twist on the Hofbrauhaus...super strange! This is not a German tradition, in any way, shape, or form.  It was kind of creepy seeing groups of drunken middle-aged men bending over to get spanked in public.  They even sell T-Shirts that announce "I've been spanked at the Hofbrauhaus"  Ok, so I can see how this is something you might enjoy, but I, for one, can certainly skip it.

AlU8s_gND6aPaeeixVKFAA.text: Place was not bad and not good, Food was Tasty but this place is waaay to loud I didn't know it was going to be like that, and not to mention every other minute you hear several "WAAACKS" from people getting spanked at every other table and in between Horns blowing, it was really different.

flGJXbXdldyOm4VG4vieUw.text: Yeaaaa!! This place is truly wierd and fantastic! The sausages were exceptional, the beer was standard and the atmosphere is totally bizarre.  If you're into the kind of experience where you're not sure whether you're in on the joke or just witness to a very strange happenstance of awkward...this is your place!!

-49CT5_Ade6yUGIe4Kla-g.text: Sausage, sausage, sausage, and Sauerkraut.  Not a big fan, unless you're a fan of sausage and sauerkraut.  It was a very loud environment with a live band, and the ladies/waitress were slapping ppl in the a$$ with a wooden paddles. If you like that, drop on by!!  I will pass ;)

C6QoH15F2emmtXQ7zPhjew.text: Angelina made our experience at Hofbrauhaus outstanding!! Thanks! Great service, great beer and great food!!

nn8GED_NmTtg13afc5l7Pw.text: Kitsch at its finest and I wouldn't have it any other way. We have a long-standing tradition of meeting with a group of friends here every fall and we're never disappointed. The music is fun, the food is German (not everybody's cup of tea, but I like it - and there are always the giant pretzels), the beer is deliciously large, and the people-watching is spectacular. Prost!

GJWxO1v_8GH0BZBuPBRaDQ.text: So my wife and I went here last night to celebrate my birthday and had a whale of a time. After a few liters of beer and spend a lot of money on food, the experience was tarnished by there bold barman (you'll know who I mean) who refused to give me a glass of tab water and wanted me to buy a bottle. His attitude stank, if I wanted to be bled dry of all my money I would have gone to the casino across the road.   This company doesn't care for the customer and is just after your money.

CxAt-H9EAu13Icr253Lz9g.text: Come for the atmosphere and the spanking. Service was good, but for a German restaurant, the portions were very small. I had to ask, and pay for, a side of sub-par rye bread. The head on the beer was ridiculous. Make sure you have a snack before you get there.

byd_s2n30wFlukRkI1IkXg.text: What a fun place. Good German food, and pints of beer! If you can't get to Germany, then you need to check this place out. The waitresses wear the bar maid outfits, and are very fun and friendly. The community tables also make it fun.

xGI1Pwq_oLJ_8X9yo85Xvw.text: We were excited to find authentic food but didn't leave as happy customers. 2-3 stars

Gea4ytOd-LzTXUzPY3fcWQ.text: Nice atmosphere, rowdy at night like Oktoberfest. I've taken many clients here. Tonight had a bad experience. Hate to weigh the numerous good experiences against one bad but the fact that the server was so flippant and we got no response from management, we won't ever go back. Sorry it ended that way.

B6fF9kDzZ8IAQntLtZvXHw.text: Great food, but not as authentic as I would have liked.  Sauces lacked that "homestyle" German food taste you would find in Chicago or Milwaukee.

iCHObJzlJRzP9Tp9iEFp4Q.text: I would have given a 5 star the food was amazing beer huge and fantastic,  waitress was really super nice, until we saw some one behind us get gentle spanked by a waitress for his birthday.... I flew my sister in for her 35 birthday and wanted to take her here because it was tradition. I am German born in Munich, we brought my Dad here before he died and he loved it. We brought my mom last year, after my sons wedding in Vegas, before she went back home to VA, she loved it. I asked the waitress what was that spanking thing about? She said for a birthday you buy a shot and then get a paddle to the butt. We laughed and asked for it. It looked harmless and fun. She brought the shot on the paddle told my sister to stand up bend over on the table. She gentle spanked her once then twice then wound up and hit her as hard as she could. We of course laughed but knew she hit her way to hard. We looked at her butt when we got back to the hotel and OMG!!! It was all welted. She flew home Sunday and today it is still swollen and bruised! There was no need to hit her that hard. It is supposed to be fun and humiliating not excruciating pain. Shame on you Ms. Waitress. that was just really mean and totally un called for!! I have pictures .....

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sorry for the butt shot.. but this is what the waitress did!
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spanked way to hard on the 3rd . !!! Left huge bruise still hurts today 7/6

ezR3aCeNNJxOYymZbNguWA.text: A little on the expensive side, but tastes just like the food I had growing up!  Real fun when you go and there is live music.  Service is always exceptional!  We would go more often if the prices were just a bit lower.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A must share!

yBlLsQaRP_3FJB6dZ5yw5w.text: 2 stars.  Food is ok. Not good or great.  Service is very slow and lacking.  Apparently when u pay over $3 for a soda, you are only allowed to have 3 or 4 small cups filled with ice then it's not free anymore.  Beer is way over priced. Atmosphere  on a Monday night is mellow and lacking. 1st time last time.

n8mVlY69WorZrrKLEZAZ4A.text: Service was awful and the restaurant was slow! We had coupons for free beers, but got charged for them. We had to find a server willing to wait on us to get a second beer. Our waiter disappeared and never came back to ask about our food. We ordered a dessert to go without ice cream, it came with ice cream after we told him we couldn't have the ice cream because of allergies. We got the bill corrected, but wonder how many people end up paying for their free beer! Frustrating experience and the food was only mediocre. About par for Las Vegas.

1kpszvIQld-k6PIY3QNWlg.text: Do yourself a favor and save room for the home made apple strudel -- it was fabulous! Fun German beer  hall atmosphere and exceptional food and service!   We will definitely be back!

vTaewrQRWGjavOV45lJwtQ.text: Without a doubt, I enjoyed the food and German beer that was served.  The servers did a good job and were playfully entertaining.  Unfortunately, there were two big negatives that detracted from the experience:  First, the room is so noisy that you can't have a conversation with your fellow diners without literally shouting at each other.  There is a pretty even mix of crowd noise and live band music.  The band's sound was lost in the noisy room, but from what I could hear, they were not very good.  The seemed to alternate between trying to play German beer hall music and playing old pop hits...like CCR songs.  They need to decide what they are trying to be.  Second, when I went to pay the bill, I was informed there would be an extra fee of about 3% if I wanted to use my credit card.  Based on that alone, I will not be returning for another meal.

T3csiiUcJhzY8htPn6hB-g.text: For my recent birthday (April 5 - mark your calendars for next year!), I originally made reservations for Rosemary's. However, a few hours prior, I decided that I couldn't go to Vegas without visiting HB.   I'm soooo glad that I made this last-minute change of plans!  The band playing that night was awesome! They played oldies and even the Star-Spangled banner.   Sadly, I only had the 1/2 liter of beer, while my boyfriend had two 1-liters. If you come here, definitely order the pretzel. It's humongous! It was so good that it was gone before I could take a picture.   Our server spanked me with a wooden paddle. She just got hired a week ago. Man, she must love her job.   HB - I'll see ya when I'm back in town! Luv ya!

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Schnitzel - Yum-O

w252489AyUh5YwUpweVN1g.text: This place was freakin awesome!  Sausage, sauerkraut, liter beers!  Are you kidding me ?

R3R2JNpK-WJN6wwhC2lw2Q.text: Nothing to complain about.... Very fun spot! Raucous crowd - all drinking good imported German beer. Live band and emcee! Just a fun night of waving 34 oz. beer steins around.   The food was classic German and was very good.   The beer is expensive for a pint, but it is almost 3-12oz. beers worth.   If you have a large group and want to have some good, clean fun in Vegas, come here!!

S37iwgUC9RJRP0fmuKWSZw.text: Eat, drink, and be merry... mostly drink!!  It's a Bavarian beer wonderland.  Tickey tockey, tickey tockey, Prost Prost Prost!  The brew band is a lot of fun with hits like the 'Don't forget to drink' song and 'It's time to drink'.  The beer and food is yum yum in the tum tum.  Be warned though, the food is quite rich & heavy.    You'll notice the Jagermeister shot girls working the floor.  Apparently if you opt to do a Jager shot with these gals they'll spank you with a vented paddle that reminds me a frat house spanking stick.  Some of the girls gave folks a gentle little pat pat, and then there were others who really wound up and whacked the crap out of their customers.  So if you plan to partake in the Jagers & spankings, you might want to strategically select your shot gal.  Use caution in the parking lot, as there are a lot of panhandlers.

D475QCu3awApVRRGGRmtng.text: What could be better in life than a German inspired beer hall smack dab in Vegas?!  Thought of anything, because I couldn't!  First of all the atmosphere here is amazing.  You are swept into a huge hall adorned with long tables where you are seated among strangers - who you will soon become best friends with!! Clinking your beer filled steins and singling along to the live music.  Simply amazing.  It doesn't stop there!  The food is phenomenal.  Start off with a homemade pretzel with their various dipping sauces, you'll be glad you did.  It's enough to share - especially if you want room for more beer and your main course.  I had the Schnitzel Wiener Art, a breaded pork cutlet with cranberry (on the side) and a side dish of bavarian potato salad.  Delicious - portion is huge!!! I ate a good half and enjoyed every last bite.  This is a must for any Vegas trip!  Order your friend a shot and hilarity will ensue.

m9FythtwE5iEVa62LOEOVg.text: The Hofbrauhaus has always been excellent to me and become a must stop during my visits to Las Vegas. Being native German, I appreciate the atmosphere the HB Las Vegas has to offer on busy nights. The beers and food are excellent, and while most of the waitresses are far from authentic, we once had a German lady that was an absolute blast. She was awesome!! Receiving a spanking for having Jager shots can be a LOT of fun for the right group. One drawback to the HB Vegas is that it can be slow at times, even on weekends, and the atmosphere occasionally suffers from this. However, when busy, the place is an absolute blast. The HB house beers are full of flavor and very authentic German.  Make sure you go with a group that appreciates the German culture and it's food since the menu may be too limited for those who don't.  If you are looking for a loud place, great beer and authentic German food the the HB Las Vegas has a fantastic evening in store for you.

8Gajar6tdZFRt3x9Alkt9A.text: beer ok, kind of expensive since the service not too good, most of the servers looked not happy, not many smiles here, mostly drunks getting their butts whacked....no management around, just young girls at door and grumpy servers.....need a boss or owner around to make sure people happy and being looked after.....and the beer garden in the back was closed...bummer

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fun fun
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BpMq9K6u5hfxsiYPdYWFuw.text: Things I ordered:  1) Jumbo pretzel - Served with spicy mustard, sweet mustard, and some combo of cheese spread.  A slightly crispy outside, with a nice chewy inside.  The cheese spread was delicious.  The pretzel was good, but would've been better if it was warm.  2) Hofbrauhaus hahnchen - Grilled chicken with a mushroom sauce and spatzle.  The chicken was nice and juicy, the mushroom sauce was nice and not intensely mushroomy, but the spatzle was annoying bland.  It was my first time having spatzle, so I wasn't sure what I should have expected, but no amount of sauce was able to help it out.  Our server's name was Sam, and she was awesome.  She gave us some great advice about the menu and was very funny.  The smacking of the butts with the shots was truly entertaining.  It was dinner and a show!  Major down side was how outrageous the prices were.  Outrageus!

oUaNNSMlVgaxyJxR5kEOHQ.text: Honestly, I don't understand why anyone would want to hang out at a place that is SO LOUD. It's completely impossible to have a conversation without screaming into the ears of your neighbors - not my idea of a fun time.  My boyfriend and I wanted to try the one vegan dish on their menu: two vegan frankfurters with curry sauce and french fries. It was taking a long time to get our food, so I asked the waitress if the rye bread or pretzels were vegan, and clarified that vegan means no cheese, no butter, no milk, no eggs. She said she would check, but kept forgetting. Finally, by the time our meal came out an hour later, she said she had remembered to ask the cooks, and both the bread and pretzels either have butter in them or on them. At that point I didn't care to investigate further.  The frankfurters and curry sauce were very good, but the french fires appeared to be plain old frozen fries - very bland. For $14.95 I was not impressed.

ocwQmoPx-D0YuyrnfCzsPg.text: I've been here many times and have never been so disappointed that I've turned to yelp. Most experiences here have been mediocre at best, but everyone knows that you come here for the ambiance and service, not the lukewarm, stale food or terrible beer. Bad food and beer aside, this time the service was terrible! It started in the parking lot. They have a "complimentary valet" that starts in the evening. The day I went, the valet started early because they were having some event. Had I known, I would've parked at UNLV down the street. Instead, I pulled in unknowingly and got stuck at the "complimentary" valet. I told the valet attendant that I did not have cash with me and asked if there was an area set aside for patrons who couldn't use valet. He very rudely said I could park somewhere else or walk to an ATM. I then politely asked to leave the parking lot to go park somewhere else (since they were blocking the route to the only exit with cones). He very rudely replied with, "I guess this is complimentary but you really should visit an ATM before you leave."  Luckily I was able to borrow a few dollars from a friend, but I was horrified with the scam they have going on in their parking lot. I disagree with the valet for many reasons, yes, the parking lot is small but this in no way necessitates a valet. Further, it creates a long wait time to leave. I was one of two people waiting for the car to be pulled around. We both waited 10 minutes. I would've rather walked to my car (it would've been faster).   It should also be noted that the server was not attentive but it was a busy night. I was only able to order 1 beer because he never returned to my table. While I would've liked another beer- I am happy that I didn't waste another $9.00 on crappy beer. My sausage was lukewarm and kind of gross but the potato salad was good.   If you're looking for an October Fest experience, there are plenty of events happening throughout the valley. Don't waste your time on this tourist trap.

0GNRRIom_boSNGFUdQrnsQ.text: As a vegan, I was really excited about their vegan option. The place is very unique, because you sit on wooden benches with strangers, people dance on the tables, there's a live ethnic band playing, and waitresses brutally spank people with a paddle when they take a shot.  The food was just all right and overpriced, along with the alcohol (what you'd expect), but it was interesting.

ekz1jPPTM-vjdZq7rOJ2fg.text: Hofbrauhaus House. hofbrauhauslasvegas.com This is as average example of Americanized Bavarian foods and average cooking skills. If you're looking for authentic Bavarian food, this is not it folks. What do you expect? It's Vegas. 1. Potato soup was good, nice flavor. Recommend. 2. Potato pancakes were tasteless, smashed flat, and served with cold applesauce, needs to be warm guys. I do not recommend them. 3. Bavarian Liver Mousse was tasty. Recommend. 4. The Munchner Weisswurste were good. Recommend. 5. Pretzel (accompanying 3 & 4) were previously froze and tasted freezer burned. They were NOT freshly hand-made whatsoever. Do NOT recommend. 6. Jagerschnitzel Pork Cutlet was dried out nd overcooked. The topped with creamy Mushroom Sauce, Bacon and Onions...where? It was a baby dollop of gravey. Spatzle? Not even close to being cooked correctly. We were served soggy noodles. Highly DO NOT recommend. 7. HB Riesenbratwurst sausage was good, the bread Ok. Accompanying fries, Ok. 8. Our service was excellent and I tipped out waiter well. 9. The building was laid out like a bier hall, very nice. 10. Had three different biers, their tapped biers, all were good.

Lk_TJswdinYeOoCC7vASbQ.text: I"m still a fan!  Went last Saturday night. Definitely not as crowded as it is during Oktoberfest. But the beer was still good and the food was very tasty!  Great sing along place if you want to chill, laugh, and drink a beer. It's caddy corner to the Hardrock Hotel .

UtE-DK-UjNi--RkK6uvs7A.text: Well the beer is awesome and I saw someone getting a whipping with a paddle. Some sort of shot. So that was pretty great.  Everything else is not so much. The sausage, kraut and dipping sauces for the pretzel weren't good. The pretzel however was pretty special.  My advice is to get the pretzel and a great beer then move on. It was pretty empty when I was there and the beer garden that is beyond the hall didn't seem to be open and that is sad because it seems like the best place to be.

CiSumcZGnJ8wspbQWYeQHw.text: Have never experienced German food.. the pork sausage.. was amazing.  The beer "Dunkel" was smooth... no bitterness.  Great experience

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sihy8oiIYBbGnQ8puAkAKA.text: Before coming here, there was a strong debate between the couple taking me. They were debating whether or not it was an appropriate place to take their pastor. For this young pastor from the midwest, the answer is absolutely! (Remember, pastors are people too)  The "town hall" atmosphere was really fun and kitschy and I loved all of the interaction between the staff and the diners. It was loud, crazy, German, and way too much fun! The food was also very good and hit that comfort zone. Anytime that I can have pretzels and beer is a solid day!  ziggy zaggy, ziggy zaggy, oi, oi, oi!

VUyJYz2zn_sdYSzzDfLylg.text: It was fun. The food was as expected. Enjoyed the beer. Sort of enjoyed the atmosphere. (Impossible to have a conversation with people it was so loud.) The waiter was terrible. Maybe one of the worst i've ever had.

J8vU-Zgi8W67Mb1wHZk9bQ.text: I've been living in Vegas for a while and have been told to come here a couple times. I was invited to a birthday party here on a Saturday night and did not enjoy myself. We arrived and had a drink at the bar. Finally we went into the main room. There is a band in a very echoey room playing horrible versions American music. It is packed. Every table is full of drunk people. Every table was super packed... They seriously pack the people in here. I'm pretty sure they would fail if the fire Marshall came in. I couldn't get thru most of the 'walkways'. They just put a table in the middle of the walkway if the table wants to fit more people.   So we finally order and our food isn't very good. I guess this place is all about the beer and loudness. Basically you squeeze into the booth and are touching everyone around you while screaming to have a conversation or order. You are listening to HORRIBLE music. Then you eat food that is not good and pay too much for it all!   I will not be back!

kKcuPp_TX511Q6iScr3tpA.text: The food is typical German food. Nothing extra special here. A bit pricey for what you get. I can get the same food at the German restaurant in my town.  What I didn't like is how loud the music echoed in the building. The walls and floor are hard. The sound from the band music amplified off the walls and made the music louder than it really was. It was impossible to talk with the people in my dinner party. I wouldn't mind if the band played a single song then took a 10 minute break, but they played most of time during our dinner.  If you don't need to talk to the people are are with, I would recommend this place. If you want to discuss anything at all, then go someplace else.

2-MXe9qWqQs8yhm8A_AZ1w.text: Good beer, loud echo main hall. Good atmosphere though, pretzels are great. Our waitress had attitude, felt like she didn't want to be at work. She had long blond braids, forgot her name

HSB50IFPf8F_Uv3yBZUZMg.text: If you like German draft beer and sausage, this is the place for you. It's across from Hard Rock Cafe.   I made a reservation through Yelp thinking it would be busy but we got in right away when we arrived. I didn't know what to make of this place. But it's okay to bring family/children. It's a family like environment. Don't expect booths and tables. There ain't none. It's a long wooden bench style where you can sit as many as 10 or more.   We ordered sausage, jumbo pretzel, and cheese pasta. The sausage pasta comes with a pretzel so don't order another like I did. But the jumbo pretzel was worth getting. It was soft and fluffy. The Swiss cheese pasta was unique. It's tastes like mac and cheese but even better.   This place can hold a big private parties like weddings. It's a nice place to bring the whole clan.

Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo pretzel
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LVGjc9_OEVy6YX86r1SPeg.text: This place seems like a cool place when there's a lot of people. We came on superbowl sunday right after the game....beer garden was closed, not a lot of people was there...ambience was lame. They have love music of 2 people singing german music. Service was off. Server didnt check on us much. She didn't even know that they give away free 10 oz beer of you check in on yelp. She kept forgetting my beer, i had to ask 3x for it....food was a miss for me....i got the sausage platter came with mashed pot and sauerkraut, it was just ok. Nothing special. The other dish we got was the breadded pork cutlet with mushroom gravy, came with spaetzel and cabbage, very bland and had no flavor whatsoever....spaetzel could use some seasoning....not recommended at all. The 1 liter beer was 16 dollars....quite pricey, but then again it's vegas....everything is pricey....ambience was just lame when we came....i don't thonk i will be back....

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork cutlet with mushroom gravy and fried onions. Skip it
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage platter...was just ok

URmRT2ImUZQP8bX1vs581Q.text: Its always a party at the Hoffbrauhaus.  I go for the beer and can honestly say I have drank several liters of each one they offer over the years.  The entertainment is also top notch.  The bands really do make the place festive and fun.  I have not yet been paddled but it also appears to be quite popular.  As far as the food, l only have eaten the pretzels and always spend the calories on the next beer.  The only negative is they sometimes do not have taxis waiting to take my drunk butt back to the hotel so I have crawl across the street to the Hard Rock and get a cab there.    Whenever we come to Vegas, its always the posts from the Hoffbrauhaus our friends consistently ask us about later - wanting to know about the party.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picture of the Monday night entertainment.

Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seating is German family shared seating.  You may well be siting next to someone you don&#39;t know.  But after the first beer - who cares.

NpbWwf2_m60wNhpbF4fLsw.text: The best of Munich here in the United States!! Great food awesome beer. Great atmosphere people are friendly!

uK4Nw2nP58RYGHIh-KHwwg.text: Since I haven't visited Germany yet, I gotta try the next best thing, HOFBRAUHAUS in Vegas.   The place is suppose to be the replica of the Hofbrauhaus in Munich. This place is giant!! It has 2 different rooms. One room has the band and look and feels like you're in a drinking hall and  the other one look and feels like you're outside.   Ordered the Schweinebraten, Munich roast pork, and the Nurnberger Rostbratwurst, roasted pork sausages and of course,a liter of Hofbrau original lager. It was so good. The roast pork was tender and perfectly seasoned. It was accompanied by bread pudding. The lightly seasoned bread pudding matched perfectly with the well seasoned pork. The dark beer sauce made everything come together deliciously.   The Nurnberger are 3 pork sausages matched with sauerkraut and mashed potatoes. The sauerkraut wasn't sour at all and the mashed potatoes were creamy. Yum!!  Finished the meal off with Apple Strudel, (Apfelstrudel). It's delish!! It tasted homemade. Vanilla sauce was with it. OMG!! So good!   I visited around 2:30pm, which is kinda after a lunch rush. German music was filtered, but no band. I need to come back probably around dinner and on a weekend for a more lively crowd.   Maybe visiting again for Oktoberfest?? Who's in?!?!

Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

98eigozfwGr_GzsEzXW6TA.text: By far the best German restaurant this side of Munich. The food is always amazing, service is great and the atmosphere is always rocking, it's like Oktoberfest year round.Aloha

JXv2BuV-ePfB2tWuFOA0gQ.text: The food is worth venturing off the strip for, especially with a large group, if you love German food!

DmgRAQh6YScR8DFYCsRYpQ.text: Solid giant fluffy pretzels (sweet mustard is amazing!!). For entrees all the schnitzels and everything are MASSIVE. Beers are good (particularly the maibock!) and there is a back area with giant Jenga and pong. Also a gift shop

DWW2ml-mKzCiFsH72fCHow.text: So much fun. The feel of an authentic German experience from music, to architecture, to attire. The food was delicious;  sausage tower to share. Check in on Yelp for free 10oz beer. I will be back.

4bVYze-CARCi5u1cZNb1Qg.text: Again the food, service and beer was excellent, I've been attending this establishment in more than one state and every time the visit was excellent.

1BpbMGWPukn85qTzqys0sA.text: This place is awesome and the experience and vibe is off the chain. Looking forward to visit when we come back to Vegas. #GetYouSome, #JesusTakeTheWheel.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time and it&#39;s real Jesus!!!

hwXmmxicxVUU8JxRnq2e8g.text: Yes please!! This place was well worth the trip off the strip. Wife and I had a blast trying to drink huge 34oz beers. The pretzel with 3 dips was awesome! The live music and the entertainment of seeing people get smacked with a paddle is worth it. Would recommend!!

eqjvHRpHM2aImN9AAmNfoA.text: Feeling a little adventurous tonight I decided to try the Hofbrauhaus in Las Vegas. This was my first Adventure into traditional German cuisine. The Schnitzel, Sauerbraten,and spaetzle we're amazing. I could not finish my meal as the entree plate was more than 12 inches in diameter and just full of delicious German food. I can't wait to have my apple strudel later tonight back at my hotel.  The atmosphere was very fun. The restaurant is family style with rows of tables and bench seating so you can really get to know your neighbors. The dining room is a large open hall with vaulted ceilings decorated with turn of the century German regalia with a live German band rocking the Accordion  This was the only drawback and the reason for 4 stars and not 5. At times it got quite loud and was hard to speak or hear the people next to me.  Since this was my first experience with German food the bar has been set High. I will definitely be recommending and returning to this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More food than this guy xan eat in 2 sittings
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nothing says German (or Latino) like an Accordion solo.
Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anyone up for a spanking from a busty Frauline

JPIlj6FH8iGFaEjUIpddGQ.text: Very fun atmosphere. Take a shot get a swaddle.  The waitress swats anyone with a very large stick.  If you have a large group of people I highly suggest giving this place a try.  Live music and lots of fun!  The food was absolutely amazing.  I lived in Germany and it brought back so many memories coming here as to what I experienced.

BozC1E7yTOZ-dw_nROGjmA.text: Das Boot. Paddles. Chicken Dances. Line Dancing. Table Top Singing. Stein Holding Contests.  Hofbrauhaus is not just a restaurant, it's a place of fun and pure revelry. Aside from the Stein holding contest, I participated in everything mentioned in some fashion. It was so much fun I needed video evidence of the festivities (or maybe I just blacked out).  Despite a packed house and a noisy party going on at every corner, our server was attentive and very quick with our orders and food. I opted for the 2 liter boot, because why not, it's Vegas. I also started off with the soup which had a savory chicken broth accompanied with a giant meatball. It was so good I destroyed the meatball and gulped the broth down as fast as I could. For my main course, I had the Currywurst. I've never eaten a meal so fast in my life. I don't know if it was drunken munchies, or I was super hungry, but I should have choked to death that night. In any case, the curry was delicious, not too spicy or strong. I'm used to Thai and Indian curries, so I would have preferred it that way but it was amazing in its own right. I actually dipped my fries in the sauce so I could eat it all. In hindsight, should have asked if rice was offered here!  I cleaned up all my food, and was super satisfied. After all the shenanigans, I stumbled out happily with my drinking boot and a numb rear end. I can't wait to come back for more pleasure and pain!

YrtVz3b4uC_9rYIg54aM-A.text: Beers are expensive but FUN place to go hang out for a couple of hours.

3Ux6CZaFsNbxxgKWPeMZOA.text: I met a few friends here for drinks and so they could eat dinner. It is one big room with long tables that sits different parties. My understanding is reservations are highly recommended if you want to sit in the main restaurant area. Their were a couple of bands that played the few hours we were there.   If you enjoy German food then I believe you would enjoy eating here.   The beer served cold and if you check in on YELP they offer a small beer. Not too bad!

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SL5rC_AZnMReBbdYE2wLxA.text: Overall 3.5 stars - Excellent and Must Visit!!  I am writing a review because the management team does well with responding. I had a great visit to the restaurant. The ambience made me feel like I was back in Munich, minus the table dancing :)  I plan on returning to have a beer on 9/21. The have a selection for vegetarian folks but will warn that it's decent, not great. We had the vegan Frankfurter and schnitzel.   Stay away from the vegan schnitzel  It was just two gardein chickn patties -plain-...had nothing on top of it. No sauce. At the very least we should have had the mushroom sauce included but they charged us for that.   Not a big fan of that cause that charge comes off the servers tip (sorry - if you poke me, I poke back).  The Frankfurter was the better of the two. It came with fries and served in a curry sauce. With three people, 2 half liter beers, 2 vodka sodas, a big pretzel and three entrees the bill came to $120  The management response: Our server questioned 3x whether or not she charged for the right amount of beers. That was awkward. I said we only ordered once. Are you sure? Are you sure? Like well we are sure - so you get sure too :) up until that point she did a great job serving and gave recommendations as well for the beer and vegan dining.   Keep in mind I said I'm coming back.  I want to echo that the atmosphere is wonderful. And while I may not dine with them, I most certainly have no problem ordering beers and enjoying the music. Maybe some pomme frites :)  So 5 stars for Atmosphere / 4 stars for Management Response  / 2 stars for food / 3 stars customer service.  Overall experience is 3.5  stars (14/4).

z575L784S4nZ8Ij0cB7ICA.text: First time ever at German Restaurant! We were seated immediately even though our reservation was not on the list. The waitresses all were dressed up in their German attire and were very friendly and helpful.  The entire restaurant consisted of bench tables with a live band. People would stand up on their benches, singing & dancing to the music! Such a lively atmosphere.  Beer was served in these huge 1 liter mugs. It definitely felt like a good old German social event! There was a guy bringing out a 9 foot horn and blaring it over the tables! Lots of things to enjoy watching!  The food was okay. German food consists of a lot of sausages and meat. The food was a little too salty for my taste. Minus 1 star for the food.   4 stars for the good service and entertainment. Everyone was very nice here!  Recommend for people who would definitely enjoy the German food + beer  + good music.

fLPWWC-R5tMAHmTy7jeBQQ.text: Great food and atmosphere. I ordered something from the menu that I couldn't hardly pronounce but it tasted delicious. I would recommend for family's in area looking to have a great time.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atmosphere

VnfvJ6la7L73JJEk-hsqTA.text: So we FINALLY came here for a co-worker's going away party...my first impressions of this place- big, busy, noisy, and tourist trappy.  Singing, dancing, and drinking the night away, while hearing the echoes of the dreaded wooden paddle coming in contact with someone's tush while others cheer on. Sounds like a great time!  On to the food...  Big Pretzel-Soft and chewy, loved the sweet onion sauce. Went well with my Original Brew. Pretzel too salty? Rub off excess salt! Problem solved...  Sauerbraten-Suggested by our waitress,(She states that EVERYTHING WAS SO GOOD!)the meat was soft but the spatzle and the sauce was salty. Vegetables we're too soft and mushy for my liking.  Apple Strudel- supposedly flew in from Germany like the big pretzel, I expected this to be delicious but that was not the case. The strudel dough wasn't crispy at all, and the filling was very gummy. IMHO, Price point does not match the quality of food served here. Maybe that's the way the food is supposed to be, but this is just my experience.  If I ever do return, it'll just be for the beers, pretzel and shenanigans. ALOHA!!!  SHAKA METER: \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  3

UQSic2f-7H0G8ZCj1W5FzA.text: This place is totally cool. Outside, you're in Vegas, inside you're in Munich and it's always October. I love the ambiance and overall vibe. The service was friendly and helpful, the entertainment was cool and the food was pretty solid. I love that I have this locally. To offer one slight criticism, They pound their schnitzel out pretty thin and mine was a little overcooked. Either don't pound it so thin or cook it less time. Other than that, I have no complaints. This place is great.

jcygDRg2ctZ8PQL5Whqw_w.text: It was a nice experience. The beer was perfect. We ordered the appetizer tower and it was good.   At first service was slow, I think there was a confusion with the servers. After that it was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbräuhaus Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanging out.

5hTwHpEG14nr_lY_f8d4zQ.text: I have been wanting to try this this place for a while now, and with family in town, I figured I would take the opportunity to do something pretty cool and unique to the local area.   Thou the restaurant is located in a interesting corner on Harmon and Paradise (note be aware of the one way only streets) and it being a Tuesday night, it seemed to have a lot of folks hanging out.   Food was pretty good, there are a diverse amount of both German and American food depending on one's taste's but wold recommend giving the German food a try. The one thing 2 of my family members told me was their mixed drinks seemed to be watered down but my wife said the beer was great.   The restaurant was laid out with communal seating  kinda like you would see at Oktoberfest. Being a Tuesday and kinda early, the restaurant was empty but the house band was there helping keep everyone entertained (gotta hang out for the chicken dance and some sing along)  I would say on my next trip I would be on a weekend evening when I assume the restaurant is at its busiest and check it out. All in all not a bad place to hang out for a night, have some good food, drinks and live entertainment. The kicker is, as long as everyone is participating with the show, this place can be a lot of fun.

LJ4QcrwPcGzOcmRF6e_K6Q.text: Been away an hour and Very upset with this place. Only my second one star review and anybody who has been to Newark Airport know what a hellhole that is.  This is the second bad experience in a row.  Last time I was there I brought 10 people from UNLV.  Most of them for the first time.  I made the reservation online.  I thought that would be the most convenient for both me and the restaurant.  When I arrived there they put us in the back,  I didn't even realize there was a back.  Very different atmosphere from the beer hall.  We were festive mood and the back has a stale atmosphere.  We asked our waitress to move into the beer hall.  She told me she would ask her manager.  After not coming back, I went to look for and found her up front.  She told me the Manager said there was nothing she could do.  Rather than come back and tell us, she made me come find her.

PvGtOX6CLgcOjmomz9L1ng.text: Free small beer with your yelp check in, so make sure you do that!  2 main dishes came at about 50 bucks. Now, in this town where you can get buffet at 25 bucks per person, you may question this overpriced mess, but ya know, it was actually good so, although I do think it is a bit overpriced, I was satisfied with a lot of things that I am wiling to overlook that.  We ordered the chicken schnitzle and the grillhendl entrees, and they were both very delicious. Each dish were super tasty and you can tell that it is prepared fresh (we didnt realize we were one of the last patrons prior to closing time). Service was super friendly and attentive. Food came out hot and prompt. The atmosphere and decor is what you would expect in a place like this - a bit rowdy, theres some music, and people are ready to drink and get spanked! lol.   Yeah, you get spanked with a paddle when you order a shot. So that was fun to see.   All in all, if you have a bit of loose change, I would suggest this place. But if youre more into bang for the buck, then there may be other less stellar places to go to - I mean, hey, this is Vegas!

Oh and be ready to spend some money- trust me, after one beer comes another, and then more and more!!!

NYeo0_llvWdKAT_ntU9qYw.text: We were always meaning to come here every time October rolled around so when the excuse of a going away  party we were invited to, we though it is now or never....wish I would have chosen never.  The place is huge and very cultural driven with long wooden tables and painted ceilings, this place really transports you until the food comes :(  I can't believe for a minute that people really come here for the food. Usually gravy makes everything taste better right? Not so fast here, the gravy which covered my plate or what lies beneath was not palatable at all, everything looked and tasted super processed, and as hungry as I came I left.      The service I have to say though was amazing as well as the beer but I could not help feeling trapped along with the tourist.

x5JwUScYXC0vbe3Qpm2rXQ.text: Love the beers here. We always sit at the bar to avoid the shenanigans. Salmon and pretzels are always on point. Dunkel is the best beer!!

mbwGL7xedd6BNNQAeYya4Q.text: My first time here! I've passed by this place for years and never thought to enter. I came on a Tuesday afternoon to watch the Women's USA v England soccer game. This place is huge! But sadly there were not very many people in there so it was rather empty. This place has great potential for hosting events and I could totally see a fun couple hosting their wedding reception here. I had the Oktoberfest beer which was light, refreshing, but nothing too special. I also ate the Kleine Brezen (small pretzel) with Obatzda which I would recommend. Travel Writer @ EscapeAroundTheWorld.com

NDZphKPfVsrTeHxQhGPbYA.text: I love German food...and it's rather hard to find decent fare outside of the country itself.  That being said, we had so much fun at Haufbrauhaus.    Our waiter was amazing (Coco is my new favorite guy). Entertainment topnotch, interactive and fun. My SIL got to play the alpenhorn, which was fabulous (with a mini lesson)....and she gets to add a 6th instrument to her repertoire.  We all tried different meals and none of us here disappointed.  Would I go again? Yes! Pricey...but worth it when you're in town.

0dcKjdWYiSR8cRtqLz5FiA.text: This was recommended to us by a concierge from Bavaria.  Kinda hard to beat that!  The place is large.  They have a gift shop up front, then a "beer hall" (similar to those I saw in Munich, though not quite that large), and then an indoor "biergarten").  We ordered the Braumeister special, the wurstplatte, and the grillhendl. These are all pretty authentic German and Bavarian fare.  The least appealing of the three was the wurstplatte, which is just a plate of sausages (at least one of which my wife said "this is a hot dog").  While I see why she thought that, it is a "wurst" (sausage).  I'm not a fan of brats, which was another wurst on her plate (she likes brats, so that was OK).  The grillhendl is chicken.  It was actually very tasty.  Mine was the braumeister, and came with spatzl.  I liked it.  It was simply, but flavorful.  Everyone seemed to like the beers they got.  And the server was very good, though he did disappear around the time we wanted the check.  I would probably go 3.5 stars here if I could.

cYbYjUUGTPcmhZy6qJK_bw.text: This is one of my favorite places to have a great beer and some food! I was also in Munich in Germany at HB that has the same atmosphere but for sure the same beer!!! Yes this is very authentic German restaurant in Las Vegas! I love the beer garden with fake trees and terraces around. During summer it is too hot for seating outside so this is good effort to bring outside inside :) You should try "Dunkel" dark beer ... it is very light to drink in comparison to other dark beers like Guinness or Murphy's!  If you want a shot of German brandy, which is really strong but great, you might get spanked by waitress :) All in all great place for big groups and beer lovers!
